title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger leaving could see Hector Bellerin join Barcelona | Metro News
text:
Hector Bellerin could join Barcelona if Arsenal let Arsene Wenger leave gossip Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 2:37 pm Hector Bellerin signed a new long-term deal with Arsenal in November (Picture: Getty Images) 
Arsenal risk losing Hector Bellerin to Barcelona this summer if they allow Arsene Wenger to leave the club, according to the Guardian. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Bellerin penned a new long-term contract in November worth £115,000-a-week, but is reported to have signed it on the proviso that Wenger was certain to extend his tenure, with the Frenchman’s own deal set to expire this summer. 
A poor run of form has seen speculation surrounding Wenger’s future intensify in recent weeks and, according to reports in Spain, Barcelona are ready to pounce on any uncertainty and re-sign the 21-year-old who graduated from their own La Masia academy. Like Bellerin, Mesut Ozil has also hinted his future is, in part at least, linked to Wenger’s future. The 67-year-old confirmed last week that he intended to remain in football management beyond this summer, although not necessarily with Arsenal.
